question: The most popular Zero Calorie sugar substitutes in the market are made up of Sucralose, as an artificial sweetner. Why sucralose does not have calories?
option1: Because the Sucralose is 600 times more sweet than Sucrose (Natural Sugar) and thus its low quantity gives same taste but zero calories when it is digested in the body.
option2: Because the chemical composition of Sucralose is such that its oxidation gives less calories in body compared to the Sucrose.
option3: Because Sucralose is not a Carbohydrate
option4: Because Sucralose is not digested in the body
answer: Because Sucralose is not digested in the body
explanation: The most popular Zero Calorie sugar substitutes in the market are made up of Sucralose, as an artificial sweetner. Sucralose does not have calories because Sucralose is not digested in the body.
